Question 1 of 65
Which of the following is not a caution for TCeMEP?
You chose: C)
Note: This question displayed answers in random order during the test.
A) History of seizures
B) Pacemaker
C) Children above two years of age
D) Deep brain stimulation
Points:1 / 1
Question 2 of 65
Many nerve roots that exit at the lower part of the spinal cord are called Spinal Bifida
You chose: B)
A) True
B) False
Points:1 / 1
Feedback:
The collection of nerves at the end of the spinal cord is known as the cauda equina, due
to its resemblance to a horse's tail. The spinal cord ends at the upper portion of the
lumbar (lower back) spine. The nerve roots at the end of the spinal cord that provide
motor and sensory function to the legs and the bladder continue in the spinal canal.
The cauda equina is the continuation of these nerve roots in the lumbar and sacral
region. These nerves send and receive messages to and from the lower limbs and
8/14/25, 1:32 PM Mail - Arasu, Hritik - Outlook
https://outlook.ofﬁce365.com/mail/id/AAQkAGU2N2U0ZGYyLTM3ZDEtNGZiYi05ZDViLTlmZDQ3NDNmZDQ0NQAQAEcpNz9FpjRMlwJEHtimJdE%3D2/33
pelvic organs.
A birth defect in the baby occurs when the spine and the spinal cord do not develop
completely.

Question 27 of 65
Vasospasm of AICA will result in:
You chose: A)
Note: This question displayed answers in random order during the test.
A) Complete loss of all BAEP waves with exception of cochlear microphonic
B) Increased interpeak waves III-V BAEP latencies
C) Increased interpeak waves VII-IX BAEP latencies
D) Loss of waves III-V
Points:1 / 1
Feedback:
AICA is the main source of the blood supply to the cochlea. Ischemia to AICA (branch of
the vertebral artery) will result in loss of all BAEP responses except cochlear
microphonics.

Question 43 of 65
8/14/25, 1:32 PM Mail - Arasu, Hritik - Outlook
https://outlook.ofﬁce365.com/mail/id/AAQkAGU2N2U0ZGYyLTM3ZDEtNGZiYi05ZDViLTlmZDQ3NDNmZDQ0NQAQAEcpNz9FpjRMlwJEHtimJdE%3D22/33
The Artery of Adamkiewicz is a major blood vessel supplying the:
You chose: C)
Note: This question displayed answers in random order during the test.
A) Brain
B) Cervical spine
C) Thoracic spine
D) Lower limbs
Points:1 / 1
Feedback:
The artery of Adamkiewicz, also known as the great anterior radiculomedullary artery or
arteria radicularis anterior magna, is the name of the dominant thoracolumbar
segmental medullary artery, which supplies the lower spinal cord by reinforcing the
anterior spinal artery.
The artery of Adamkiewicz is significant in that it is the only major arterial supply
supplying the anterior spinal artery along with the lower thoracic, lumbar, and sacral
segments of the spinal cord.

History of seizures, pacemaker, tongue lacerations, cochlear implants, DBS implants,
etc. are safety concerns. CP is an upper motor neuron lesion and can affect CMAP
recordings but is not a safety concern for the patient.
